why.babel-eslint: Used by Standard to parse ES6+ syntax.
why.babel-loader: Used to process modules with Babel before packaging for the browser.
why.babel-plugin-istanbul: Used for better test coverage reporting when using ES6+ syntax.
why.babel-preset-env: Supports the latest ES6+ syntax, using minimal polyfills for our supported browsers.
why.babel-register: Used to enable require()ing of files with ES6+ syntax.
why.chai: Used for expect() verifications in unit tests.
why.css-loader: Used as an intermediary loader when processing Sass styles.
why.dirty-chai: Allows us to use Chai without violating Standard rules.
why.eslint: Used to check for stray debugging statements.
why.extract-text-webpack-plugin: Used to extract styles to a file for production builds.
why.grommet: Provides a set of standardized React components for building user interfaces.
why.immutable: Immutable library to use for state storage
why.nyc: Used to produce test coverage reports.
why.prop-types: Used to implement React component property validation.
why.react-dom: Used to render React components into the DOM.
why.react-helmet: Used to modify the document <head> when switching React components.
why.react-redux: Provides utility functions for connecting React components to Redux.
why.react-router5: Provides React components for use with router5.
why.router5.helpers: Provides helper functions for matching routes.
why.standard: Automatically fixes code style inconsistencies, and provides linting suggestions.
why.webpack: Packages JavaScript modules for use in the browser.
why.webpack-dev-server: A development server that reads the Webpack configuration, and supports hot reloading.
